identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of the Effects of Co-Administration of Sitagliptin (MK-0431) and Metformin on Incretin Hormone Concentrations (MK-0431-110)
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Study to Assess the Effects of Co-Administration of Sitagliptin and Metformin on Incretin Hormone Concentrations

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study will assess the effects of sitagliptin and metformin alone and after co-administration on incretin hormone concentrations in patients with Type 2 diabetes.

armGroups.label: Placebo sitagliptin + placebo metformin
armGroups.description: Co-administration of placebo to sitagliptin and placebo to metformin

interventions.name: sitagliptin phosphate
interventions.description: Sitagliptin 100 mg tablet on Day 1 and Day 2 in the morning. There will be a 7-day washout between treatment periods.

interventions.name: metformin hydrochloride
interventions.description: Metformin 500 mg tablet in the morning and evening on Day 1 and two 500 mg tablets of metformin (total dose 1000 mg) on Day 2 in the morning. There will be a 7-day washout between treatment periods.

interventions.name: Comparator: placebo sitagliptin
interventions.description: Placebo to sitagliptin 100 mg in the morning on Days 1 and 2. There will be a 7-day washout between treatment periods.

interventions.name: Comparator: placebo metformin
interventions.description: Placebo to metformin 500 mg tablet in the morning and evening on Day 1 and two placebo to metformin 500 mg tablets (1000 mg total dose) in the morning of Day 2. There will be a 7-day wash out between treatment periods.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Incremental Post-prandial 4-hour Weighted Mean Active Glucagon-like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) Plasma Concentrations
primaryOutcomes.description: Meal was given 2 hours postdose. Blood samples for determination of active GLP-1 concentration were collected (4 hours postmeal) on Day 2 in each treatment period.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 hours postdose (4 hours postmeal) on Day 2

secondaryOutcomes.description:
β-cell sensitivity was defined as the incremental post-prandial

4-hour area under the curve (AUC) for insulin secretion rate (ISR) normalized by the incremental post-prandial 4-hour plasma glucose AUC.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 hour post-dose (4 hour postmeal) on Day 2

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incremental Post-prandial 4-hour Weighted Mean Plasma Glucose Concentrations
secondaryOutcomes.description: Meal was given 2 hours postdose. Blood samples for determination of glucose concentration were collected (4 hours postmeal) on Day 2 in each treatment period.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 6 hours postdose (4 hours postmeal) on Day 2

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Female subjects must have a negative pregnancy test
* Subject has type 2 diabetes and is not currently receiving treatment with an oral AHA agent, has not received such treatment for 3 months prior to study, and/or has not received more than 4 total weeks treatment with an oral AHA agent for 12 to 18 months prior to the study
* Subject is a nonsmoker or has not smoked and/or used nicotine for at least 6 months

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subject has a history of stroke, seizures, or major neurological disorders
* Female subject is breastfeeding
* Subject cannot refrain from use of any prescription or non-prescription drugs beginning 2 weeks prior to first dose of study drug
* Subject consumes more than 3 alcoholic beverages per day
* Subject consumes more than 6 caffeinated beverages per day
* Subject has had major surgery, or has donated or lost 1 unit of blood within 4 weeks of screening
* Subject has a history of cancer, except certain skin or cervical cancer or other cancers treated more than 10 years prior to screening
* Subject has a history of multiple and/or severe allergies or intolerance to drugs or food

groups.title: All Participants
groups.description: Participants received four 2-day treatment regimens (sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days, metformin + placebo sitagliptin for 2 days, co-administration of sitagliptin + metformin for 2 days, and placebo sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days) with a 7-day washout between each treatment period.

groups.title: All Participants
groups.description: Participants received four 2-day treatment regimens (sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days, metformin + placebo sitagliptin for 2 days, co-administration of sitagliptin + metformin for 2 days, and placebo sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days) with a 7-day washout between each treatment period.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incremental Post-prandial 4-hour Weighted Mean Active Glucagon-like Peptide-1 (GLP-1) Plasma Concentrations
outcomeMeasures.description: Meal was given 2 hours postdose. Blood samples for determination of active GLP-1 concentration were collected (4 hours postmeal) on Day 2 in each treatment period.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: 6 hours postdose (4 hours postmeal) on Day 2

groups.title: All Participants
groups.description: Participants received four 2-day treatment regimens (sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days, metformin + placebo sitagliptin for 2 days, co-administration of sitagliptin + metformin for 2 days, and placebo sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days) with a 7-day washout between each treatment period.

outcomeMeasures.title: β-cell Sensitivity
outcomeMeasures.description:
β-cell sensitivity was defined as the incremental post-prandial

4-hour area under the curve (AUC) for insulin secretion rate (ISR) normalized by the incremental post-prandial 4-hour plasma glucose AUC.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Beta-cell sensitivity was not calculated for 1 participant following the administration of sitagliptin alone and metformin alone due to missing insulin data.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: 6 hour post-dose (4 hour postmeal) on Day 2

groups.title: All Participants
groups.description: Participants received four 2-day treatment regimens (sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days, metformin + placebo sitagliptin for 2 days, co-administration of sitagliptin + metformin for 2 days, and placebo sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days) with a 7-day washout between each treatment period.

outcomeMeasures.title: Incremental Post-prandial 4-hour Weighted Mean Plasma Glucose Concentrations
outcomeMeasures.description: Meal was given 2 hours postdose. Blood samples for determination of glucose concentration were collected (4 hours postmeal) on Day 2 in each treatment period.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: 6 hours postdose (4 hours postmeal) on Day 2

groups.title: All Participants
groups.description: Participants received four 2-day treatment regimens (sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days, metformin + placebo sitagliptin for 2 days, co-administration of sitagliptin + metformin for 2 days, and placebo sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days) with a 7-day washout between each treatment period.

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: 43 days (four 2-day treatment periods, a 7-day washout interval between each treatment period, and approximately 14 days following the last dose of study treatment)

eventGroups.title: Sitagliptin + Placebo Metformin
eventGroups.description: Participants received sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days.

eventGroups.title: Metformin + Placebo Sitagliptin
eventGroups.description: Participants received metformin + placebo sitagliptin for 2 days.

eventGroups.title: Sitagliptin + Metformin
eventGroups.description: Participants received co-administration of sitagliptin + metformin for 2 days.

eventGroups.title: Placebo Sitagliptin + Placebo Metformin
eventGroups.description: Participants received placebo sitagliptin + placebo metformin for 2 days.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

pointOfContact.title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development

ancestors.term: Hormones, Hormone Substitutes, and Hormone Antagonists
